sub_title: Senior Technical Advisor Public Health in the RESEMBID programme executed by Expertise France
summary:
Strategic and creative development manager in biomedical science with parallel career in journalism. This combination has resulted in an extensive international network and a large amount of valuable pharmaceutical and biotech information. Extensive practical experience in cell biology, immuno-haematology and transfusion. Due to natural business acumen and negotiation competence a successful starter of new businesses. Ability to create unexpected but fruitful matches between different businesses. Stimulating personality, which helps co-workers to excel. Competence is not restricted to biomedical science only. Successful in consulting at top level management, due to good understanding of abstract science combined with excellent skills in communication of scientific matters to non-specialists. Experienced in writing articles and reports under time stress.

Specialties: Biotechnology, bioweapons, chemical weapons, inflammation science, blood transfusion, medical and technical writer (science journalist)

treasury_media.title: NATO Vyskov Bio-Threat Awareness Course handout
treasury_media.description: A lecture which gives insight why preparedness for biological threat incidents, which can be natural, an accident or man-made, is important. The resilience against biological threats needs a close cooperation between the health care first responders and the military, who support in the higher risk scenario's with their specific CBRN expertise.

treasury_media.title: NATO Vyskov Bio Consequence Management Course 2021 pdf.pdf
Threat of emerging, extremely contageous zoonotic diseases 2015
Lecture Stienstra MOSA conference 2013
treasury_media.description: Lecture discussing the bioterrorism threat given at the Mosa Congress with theme microbiology at the University of Maastricht on June 11, 2013.

profile_positions.description:
Cyber Security Global Alliance creates a global Cyber Security network and hub that will educate, certify, accredit, develop programs, offer cyber consultations, and solve the pain points for governments, military, and corporations to protect themselves from malicious threat actors and cyber-attacks no matter where they are or come from in the world today.
The Cyber Security Global Alliance is building its global footprint and is quickly becoming a world leader of smart cybersecurity education and cyber defense systems, becoming your Global Resource Centre for Cybersecurity to assist you in cybersecurity and -defence globally.
profile_positions.title: CSGA Board of Directors, director CBRN-related threats

profile_positions.description: The OSCE has a comprehensive approach to security that encompasses politico-military, economic and environmental, and human aspects. It therefore addresses a wide range of security-related concerns, including arms control, confidence- and security-building measures, human rights, national minorities, democratization, policing strategies, counter-terrorism and economic and environmental activities. All 57 participating States enjoy equal status, and decisions are taken by consensus on a politically, but not legally binding basis. I will work in the field of Biological Safety and Biological Security.
profile_positions.title: International Expert, Training Systems on Biological Safety and Biological Security
Didactic Board Member University of Rome Tor Vergata for the CBRN MSc

profile_positions.description:
The Resilience, Sustainable Energy and Marine Biodiversity Programme for Caribbean Overseas Countries and Territories (RESEMBID) is funded by the European Union, under the 11th European Development Fund (EDF), and implemented through Expertise France. The programme offers a demand-driven and bottom-up approach to technical assistance for the twelve Overseas Countries and Territories (OCT) of the Caribbean. These are: Aruba, Bonaire, Curaçao, Saba, Sint Eustatius, Sint Maarten, Anguilla, British Virgin Islands, Cayman Islands, Montserrat, Turks and Caicos, and Saint Barthélemy. RESEMBID will be developed over 2019-2023 based on three main pillars: Sustainable Energy, Marine Biodiversity, and Resilience.
I have joined the program to support the new fast-tracked €10 million COVID-19 mechanism supporting the Caribbean OCTs in their efforts at managing and responding to the impact of pandemic threats. The RESEMBID COVID-19 Resilience Response Facility will be a flexible, fast-track granting facility that will allow each territory to develop initiatives in the response to the pandemic.
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Advisor Public Health in the RESEMBID programme executed by Expertise France

company.name: NATO Joint CBRN-defense Centre of Excellence

profile_positions.company: NATO Joint CBRN-defense Centre of Excellence
profile_positions.description: In Vyskov I give to CBRN specialists courses and workshops in bio-defense, biosafety & biosecurity and CBRN-resilience. The NATO Joint-CBRN CoE organizes also courses on location in both NATO and non-NATO countries.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer CBRN

profile_positions.description: Giving several lectures on several CBRN topics, but most of my lectures are on bio-defense and -resilience in different courses given at the NATO School in Oberammergau.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer CBRN

profile_positions.description:
Current projects:

MT-Derm, Berlin, Germany (www.mtderm.de) Developing a system to vaccinate intradermally realising quick immunisation, which is done by a tattoo-like injection instrument.

Develops with Dafra Pharma in Belgium  (www.dafra.be) a new treatment technology for cutaneous leishmaniasis in cooperation with Institute Pasteur for the clinical evaluations (financially supported by the prize money of the Canadian Grand Challenges program). 

Sulfateq BV, Groningen, The Netherlands. Involved in research to bring human cells into a phase of hibernation like the brown bear and squirrel can do during their winter sleep. Technique used to store human thrombocytes at 4° C in blood banks for platelet transfusions, but the technology is also promising for cell- and tissue engineering, where it facilitates the logistics of engineered cell material in cell or tissue therapies. 

InControl Simulations Solutions, Utrecht, The Netherlands (incontrolsim.com): Although half a day a month it is attractive to be CBRNe-advisor for InControl that develops crowd control simulation software for the management of evacuation of persons out of a theater, (football) stadium, congress hall or shopping mall after an CBRNe incident, while the first responders can still approach the  incident site and all evacuees pass the  decontamination stations.
profile_positions.title: Current projects

profile_positions.description:
Hemanua Ltd, Dublin, Ireland (www.hemanua.com): an Irish start-up company, which has developed (I am co-inventor on the patent), in collaboration with the Irish Blood Transfusion Service,  a product for producing convalescent plasma as a treatment for Ebola Virus Disease. The ProBlood CP has the capability to enable the harvesting and the transfusion of convalescent plasma  (CP) without electricity and driven only by gravity thereby providing a real advantage in remote and less developed regions such as West Africa and has additional advantages as it produces totally cell free plasma. MSF is now doing clinical work with it in West-Africa. (t 2017)

InfectionControl, Eemnes, The Netherlands (www.infectioncontrol.eu) Development of a device to disinfect high value instruments and areas, which are contaminated by biological threats or by bioterror attacks. (t 2015)

Hemacon GmbH, Düsseldorf, Germany (www.hemacon.com) Giving support in the research for improvement, in development and clinical evaluation of an innovative donor blood separation device. 

IQ-Therapeutics, Groningen, The Netherlands (www.iqtherapeutics.nl) Business development of therapeutic vaccines. (Anti-anthrax lethal factor therapeutic antibodies) (t 2012)

IB Consulting, The Hague, The Netherlands (www.ibconsultancy.eu)
Giving support in homeland defense CBRNe programs. (t 2012)

Innotact Consulting, Leusden, The Netherlands (www.innotact.com) Consulting and business development in life sciences. 

CellCoTec, Bilthoven, The Netherlands (www.cellcotec.com): Developed a clinical cell processor for the CellCoTec cell-based therapeutic technology using chondriocytes and stem cells in a biodegradable scaffold for cartilage repair, which can be delivered in a single surgery. 

Heim Medizintechnik, Gladbeck, Germany. Developed a blood separation device producing blood components for transfusion with hollow fibre technology. It works solely on gravity and is ideal for underdeveloped countries and battlefield.
profile_positions.title: Finished Projects

profile_positions.description: In the sidelines I write articles about science & technology, (bio)defense and automotive for several professional publications and newspapers (e.g. Financieel Dagblad; Challenge).
profile_positions.title: Writer
